instruction: What metric was chosen and how far can this metric go in the study on identifying CRISPR/Cas9-induced rice mutants?
Output: The metric chosen in the study on identifying CRISPR/Cas9-induced rice mutants was classification accuracy. The study aimed to build discrimination models for classification using support vector machine (SVM) and extreme learning machine (ELM). The best performance was achieved by the SVM-successive projections algorithm (SPA) model, which achieved classification accuracies of 93% and 92.75% for huaidao-1 and 91.25% and 89.50% for nanjing46 in the calibration and prediction sets, respectively. This metric indicates the accuracy of the model in correctly identifying the CRISPR/Cas9-induced rice mutants from their acceptor lines.

instruction: Can hyperspectral imaging in the near-infrared range, combined with chemometric analysis, be considered a superior method compared to traditional methods for identifying CRISPR/Cas9-induced rice mutants?
